intro: Acourtia rigida var. linearifolia, commonly known as the linearleaf rigid acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. The species is notable for its resilience to drought and its role in supporting local ecosystems.
